title: 111_hr3972
content: The "Congress 2014 Commission Act" establishes the "Congress 2014 Commission" with specific duties outlined for the Commission. The Commission established by the "Congress 2014 Commission Act" is tasked with analyzing the size of the House of Representatives, exploring alternative methods of electing Representatives, addressing the decline in adherence to political parties, and considering ways to increase citizen participation in the electoral process. The Commission established by the "Congress 2014 Commission Act" will examine methods to provide greater representation in the House of Representatives for various territories and submit a report with legislative proposals by the end of the One Hundred Twelfth Congress. SEC. 4. MEMBERSHIP. The Commission, established by the "Congress 2014 Commission Act," consists of 17 members appointed by the President, House of Representatives, and Senate. Members must be qualified in politics or government. Each member serves for the life of the Commission, and vacancies are filled promptly. The Commission consists of 17 members appointed by various entities. Members serve for the life of the Commission, vacancies are filled promptly. Each member, excluding full-time officers, receives pay and travel expenses. Nine members constitute a quorum, and the Chairman is elected by the members. The Chairman of the Commission is elected by the members. The Commission meets at the call of the Chairman or a majority of its members. SEC. 5. STAFF. The Chairman of the Commission may appoint up to six staff members without following standard government hiring procedures. These individuals can be paid up to the maximum rate for a GS-15 employee. Additionally, the Chairman can hire temporary services as needed at specified rates. The Commission can appoint staff members at rates not exceeding the maximum annual rate of basic pay for grade GS-15. Federal agencies can detail personnel to assist the Commission on a reimbursable basis. SEC. 6. POWERS OF COMMISSION. The Commission may hold hearings, take testimony, and receive evidence. Members and agents can take actions authorized by the Commission. The Commission can use the United States mails and receive administrative support services. SEC. 7. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. SEC. 7. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. $5,000,000 is authorized to carry out this Act, available until expended. SEC. 8. TERMINATION. The Commission will cease to exist when its report is submitted under section 3.
